Albania: Local Albanian noble families began to emerge.
Serbia occupied parts of northern Albania.
Estonia: Bishop Albert and his crusaders capture Riga in Latvia.
Nepal: Aridev malla, first monarch of the Malla Dynasty, rules in Kathmandu Valley (to 1216)
Philippine: The Indonesians of the Majapahit in the 13th century went to Palawan, they brought with them Buddhism and preached to the natives, natives converted their faith from Animism and become Buddhists.
The process of Kabayan mummification had begun in Ibaloi Benguet which is also called Fire mummies.
Tonga: Muʻa became the capital of the Tongan Empire.
